docs.title: Welcome to Imagine RP
docs.text: ImagineRP is a GTA RP Server that doesn't take things too seriously

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text:
Is this server streamer friendly?

Yes, we work to ensure there's no explicit content in the server. If you spot any, please let us know.

The server may still contain copyrighted content - see copyrighted content

Is the server open to anyone?

The server is invite only during the testing phase

While we're relatively lenient about who we allow in, the server remains invite only. This may change at a later time.

Does this server have copyrighted music?

Loadscreen music is copyright free

Yes - GTA V contains copyrighted music in the game

You should turn down the radio volume and such in your GTA game settings if this is a concern for you.

docs.title: Default Keybinds
docs.text:
Your keybinds may differ

These keybinds are the default keybinds, and not necessarily what your keybinds may be set to.

Global Keybinds Scenario Specific Job Specific

Global Keybinds

  • On Foot

    Control Keybind Get Up after revival ,

  • Vehicles

    Control Keybind Seatbelt Ctrl+X Reset Airbags Alt+X Push Vehicle Ctrl+Eat front or back of the car

  • UI

    Control Keybind Targeting Left Alt Chat T Close IDClose Driver's LicenseClose Weapon License Backspace

Scenario Specific

  • Robberies

    Control Keybind Start Robbery G Bail on robbery in progress X

Job Specific

  • Police

    Control Keybind Start Robbery G Bail on robbery in progress X

docs.title: Targeting System
docs.text:
Use Left Alt to target certain things within the world and interact with them.

This is required for things like interacting with ATMs, Bank Desks, Houses, Car Catalogs, etc.

You will need to hold Left Alt and then walk near the interaction point.

Line up the and click then click on the option you want to carry out.

docs.title: Installing
docs.text:
• Make sure you have installed and updated GTA V
  • Download FiveM from the website Run FiveM.exe. If you run the installer in an empty folder, FiveM will install there. Otherwise, it will install in %localappdata%\FiveM
  • Start FiveM from your Start menu

docs.title: Having trouble?
docs.text:
• Minimum Requirements

    Your PC will need to meet the minimum requirements set by GTA V & FiveM

    See Requirements

  • Client Issues Guide

    You'll need to apply for access to the server

    Client Issues Guide

docs.title: Minimum Requirements
docs.text:
PC Only

FiveM is not available to play on console

FiveM has similar minimum requirements to GTA V and requires that you have GTA V installed on your computer.

  • GTA V Installed

    You'll need to have a copy of GTA V already installed on your PC. If you don't already own GTA V you can purchase it from Steam, Epic, Rockstar, etc.

    It must be a legally owned copy, and you will need Rockstar Social account

  • FiveM Installed

    FiveM needs to be installed on your PC

    Install FiveM

  • Meet system requirements

    Your PC will need to meet the minimum requirements set by GTA V & FiveM

    See Requirements

  • Applied for entry

    You'll need to apply for access to the server

    TODO

docs.title: Could not find game executable
docs.text:
Locate the CitizenFX.ini file within your FiveM Application Data and make sure it is pointing to the correct path. Open the file with a text editor such as Notepad and edit the path to your GTA V installation if necessary.

If you continue to run into issues we recommend contacting CFX/FiveM

docs.title: FiveM is already installed error
docs.text:
After you have installed FiveM, you don't need the downloaded FiveM.exe file anymore. Feel free to delete it.

Use the shortcut from your Windows start menu to launch FiveM

docs.title: Game cache outadated
docs.text:
If you receive this error, press Yes if the dialog asks Do you wish to continue

If you get an error like DLC files are missing, make sure your game is up to date by following the instructions in the dialog box. Also make sure your CitizenFX.ini points to the correct GTA V installation. You can find that file within your FiveM Application Data.

docs.title: Error generating ROS entitlement token
docs.text: Certain antivirus programs block FiveM. Try disabling or uninstalling your antivirus software and try again or contact CFX/FiveM.

docs.title: Error loading component xyz.dll
docs.text:
Delete caches.xml from your FiveM application data folder. If there is no such file, delete the entire application data folder and run FiveM again.

For adhesive.dll see below

docs.title: Error loading component adhesive.dll
docs.text:
Your Windows 10 Installation is out of date. Update to at least Windows 10 1703 and try again.

To check your current version of Windows press Win+R type winver and press Enter

docs.title: Opening database (privcache:/) failed:
docs.text:
IO Error: could not lock file

Your privcache got corrupted. Delete the "priv" folder from your cache folder located in your FiveM application data

docs.title: Entry Point Not Found
docs.text: Delete v8.dll, v8_libbase.dll, and v8_libplatform.dll if available in C:\Windows\system32\ directory. These are leftover files from other applications that incorrectly use system32 to place these files. FiveM loads dll's from system32 first, resulting in these incorrect dll's being loaded

docs.title: Moving of xyz.exe failed (err = 32)
docs.text: First check your task manager for existing FiveM related processes; if you see them, close the. If that doesn't fix the issue, you may want to contact CFX/FiveM as it's likely related to your antivirus.

docs.title: Stuck on 'We're getting there and it will be worth the wait'
docs.text: If this occurs, it's typically related to antivirus settings. You may want to contact CFX/FiveM regarding your antivirus.

docs.title: Stuck on a rotating splash screen
docs.text: Delete %appdata%\citizenfx\ros_id.dat and %localappdata%\digitalentitlements

docs.title: Stuck on a black screen
docs.text: This most often occurs with certain NVIDIA drivers. Stay patient and give it a minute or so to load, and it'll often succeed. You may also want to update your GPU drivers if available.

docs.title: Stuck on a colored background but no menu
docs.text:
This happens typically on older AMD laptop GPUs. Unfortunately, this is caused by CEF and not FiveM.

There is a potential workaround on the CFX forums, but until CEF fixes the root issue, these may not work permanently.

docs.title: FiveM uninstalled itself after running
docs.text: This is most likely your antivirus software. You may want to submit a support ticket about your antivirus here.

docs.title: I have an NVIDIA GPU and FiveM hanged
docs.text:
FiveM hangs when using NVIDIA GPUs as of recently are not uncommon (and especially on the most recent drivers). As of now, CFX are trying to figure out how to resolve hangs for NVIDIA but they're requesting help from users. You can collect information to help them, and us!

Do not close any processes

It's very important that you do not close any processes while following these steps, or you will not be able to capture the required information to help CFX/FiveM

  1. Press Win+R and type taskmgr and then press
  2. Once Task Manager opens, go into the Details tab
  3. Find FiveM_GTAProcess.exe, right click it, and click on Create dump file
  4. Wait until the process is dumped, it will be created in the following directory: C:\Users\<your_name>\AppData\Local\Temp\FiveM_GTAProcess.DMP
  5. Click Open File Location and zip up the following file FiveM_GTAProcess.DMP by right clicking it, followed by clicking Send To -> Compressed (zipped) folder on the context menu
  6. Contact CFX Support

docs.text: I am sure we will have something to post here soon. But for now, this is a placeholder in our blog section.
